biological_system: Human sweet taste receptor (Class C GPCR heterodimer) expressed in taste receptor cells and heterologous systems (e.g., HEK293)
desired_modulation: Agonism, partial agonism, or modulation of sweet perception
corresponding_assay: Cell-based calcium flux assay (co-expression of TAS1R2/TAS1R3 with Gα16, Gαgustducin, or chimeric G proteins); optional IP₃ or cAMP reporter assays
metric_used: EC₅₀, Emax, response shift vs reference sweetener
rationale: TAS1R2 provides the primary orthosteric binding site for most sweet ligands within the VFT domain, while TAS1R3 functions as an obligate co-receptor enabling receptor assembly, conformational signaling, and stabilization of the active state; effective sweet taste signaling requires the intact heterodimer
crystallized_structure: Yes (VFT-domain structures of the heterodimer available; e.g., PDB 9NOW, 9NOS)
